Of late, some cases of accidental firing have taken place in Units of this sector including
the Airport Units, GBS and the 2™ Reserve Battalion. Inquiries have shown that in fact, all
these cases are the cases of negligence i.e firing taking place on account of negligence of our
personnel. As Units of this sector are deployed in places where large number of civil persons
are also present, it is extremely essential that such firings are treated as extremely serious

9 situation:-

3 i) Handing over and taking over of the arms should always take place in the
° ‘Kote’ and not at or near the place of duty.

e ii) All safety measures should be taken while handing/taking over a weapon.
e iii) | Sub-Inspector in-charge of the Kote must remain present at the time of
e issue and testing of the weapon by the personnel. If a wrong procedure is
e being adopted by the duty personnel, it is the responsibility of the Sub-
o Inspector in-charge Kote to point it out and correct it immediately.

$ iV) In case of such firing in future, both the duty personnel concerned and the
O Sub-Inspector in-charge Kote should be placed under suspension with
oO immediate effect.

ce) v) After preliminary inquiry, as far as possible, action under rule 36 of CISF
8 Rules should be taken against the personnel concemed i.e. Sub-Inspector
oO in-charge Kote and others who may have been negligent.

Oo vi) A Training Capsule of 03 days giving intensive inputs on weapon handling
